activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse
Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Richard Fox

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM Defendant Benjamin Richard Fox in court. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Benjamin Richard Fox. Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Victims appearing telephonically. Bennett states has discussed with Schiek - $30,000 apart in agreement. Schiek willing to work on restitution - would like to set for Jury Trial. Court to set for 1 day jury trial. Bond continued. adj. 03:36 PM
Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin Richard Fox in court. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Benjamin Richard Fox. Victims appearing telephonically. Bennett statement to restitution - should have a resolution once final number is agreed upon - would like to set out. Sowinski states victims will be addressing court at next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 03:42 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin Richard Fox in court. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Benjamin Richard Fox. Victims appearing telephonically. Bennett states they are working on a resolution - would like to set out. Schiek has no objection. Bond continued. adj. 02:07 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Ross Fox in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Benjamin Ross Fox.  Alleged Victim appears audio only.  Court notes has been handed a waiver or preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Atty Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Atty Bennett willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Atty Bennett statement to court regarding defendant's middle name being wrong on complaint and notes it should be Richard.  Bond continued. adj. 11:38 a.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
3rd party may pick up personal property/all other conditions remain

2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin Ross Fox in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Benjamin Ross Fox. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Victim now appearing telephonically. Bennett statement to Defendant's property - would like 3rd party to retrieve. Schiek has no objection to return of property. Court amends bond conditions. adj. 02:42 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Schiek states has complied with Marsy's Law. Schiek statement to bail. Court verifies address with Defendant/household. Court sets bond. adj. 01:37 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
